results.title: An Unmarried woman
results.creator_credit: Paul Mazursky, Tony Ray and Fox
results.brief_description: Jill Clayburgh and Alan Bates star in this excellent production depicting the reconstruction of a life, as Clayburgh struggles to find herself after her husband leaves her for another woman. Torn between conflicting forces, her lovers and her daughter, Clayburgh learns to take control of her life. This film became a beacon for the Women’s Movement in the 1970’s.

results.title: Two thousand women
results.creator_credit: Frank Launder, Edward Black and Gainsborough Pictures
results.brief_description: Phyllis Calvert, Patricia Roc and Flora Robson star in this vivid document of 1944: a time when women were finding a new independence, and women stars and audience were taken seriously by British cinema. This intense story of a prisoner of warcamp in occupied france, takes the classic formulas common to male prison camp drama and transforms them. The women stand up to the enemy, outwit their jailers, help inmates to escape without tears or hysteria. They are mutually supportive in the face of their privations and their story is told through a woman’s eyes rather than from the male perspective

results.title: Death in Brunswick (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Ruane, Timothy White, Film Finance Corporation Australia, Film Victoria and Meridian Films
results.brief_description: Carl Fitzgerald (Sam Neill) is the hard-luck hero in this pleasant little black comedy set in the Melbourne suburb of Brunswick. Carl lands a chef’s job in the cockroach infested kitchen of a dodgy nightclub. He meets a luscious young barmaid (Zoe Carides) who has the hots for him, but as luck would have it, the rocky romance is headed for trouble when an unfortunate incident at the club embroils Carl in a complicated mess. He enlists the help of his mate Dave (John Clarke)…things can only get worse from here on.

results.title: 'At the movies': Tim Burton masterclass with Margaret Pomeranz
results.brief_description: Hosted by Margaret Pomeranz, this masterclass reveals the workings behind Tim Burton’s creative genius, offering insight into his creative process with a rare view into his world of melancholic misfits, gothic suburbia and contemporary fairytales.

results.title: The Crying game
results.creator_credit: Neil Jordan, Stephen Woolley, Channel Four, Euro Trustees, Nippon Film Development & Finance and Palace Films
results.brief_description: Full of surprises, this film did more than win extraordinary critical acclaim throughout the world. It upstaged the competition by receiving six Academy Award nominations and an Oscar for Best Screenplay. Set in Ireland, this spellbinding thriller involves a black British soldier, Jody (Forest Whittaker), who befriends his reluctant IRA captor, Fergus (Stephen Rea). When Jody is killed in an ambush, Fergus fulfills his dying wish - to find his girlfriend Dil (Jaye Davidson) in England. When Fergus and Dil become romantically involved, the crying game begins. Electrifying and seductive, this is the movie that had everyone talking. Also stars Miranda Richardson.

results.title: Anatomy of a murder
results.brief_description: A riveting courtroom drama of rape and premeditated murder is brought to life with an all-star cast in Otto Preminger’s suspenseful and highly acclaimed production. Packed with drama, passion and intrigue, the film pits humble small-town lawyer, Jimmy Stewart against hard-headed city prosecutor, George C. Scott. Emotions flare as jealous army lieutenant, Ben Gazzara pleads innocent to murdering the rapist of his seductive, beautiful wife, Lee Remick. Honoured with seven Academy Award nominations and featuring a brilliant score by Duke Ellington, this film is a masterpiece that will keep you on the edge of your seat. Based on the novel by Robert Traver.

results.title: The Last days of Chez Nous
results.creator_credit: Gillian Armstrong, Jan Chapman and Saddleback Productions
results.brief_description: Beth (Lisa Harrow) is a successful novelist who runs her career and inner-city household, “Chez Nous” with great energy and humour, despite her hectic life with her French husband (Bruno Ganz), her carefree teenage daughter (Miranda Otto) and a new boarder (Kiri Paramore). The return of her younger sister, Vicky (Kerry Fox) sparks a chain of events which escalate in the intense heat of an Australian Summer and could spell the last days of “Chez Nous”. Also stars Bill Hunter.

results.title: The Student prince
results.creator_credit: Richard Thorpe, Joe Pasternak and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Edmund Purdom and Ann Bltyh star in this romantic musical set to the music of Sigmund Romberg. Prince Karl is in love, but not with the princess he is supposed to wed in a state-arranged marriage. The object of his affections is a mere Heildberg barmaid. Mario Lanza provided the singing for the film.

results.title: Unforgiven
results.creator_credit: Clint Eastwood, Malpaso Company and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Clint Eastwood’s film is an exciting modern classic that rode off with four 1992 Academy Awards including Best Picture and Director. Eastwood and Morgan Freeman play retired down-on-their-luck outlaws who pick up their guns one last time to collect a bounty offered by the vengeful prostitutes of the remote Wyoming town of Big Whiskey. Richard Harris is an ill-fated interloper, a colourful killer for hire called English Bob. Gene Hackman is the sly and brutal local sheriff whose brand of law enforcement ranges from unconventional to ruthless. Big trouble is coming to Big Whiskey.

results.title: Witness for the prosecution
results.creator_credit: Billy Wilder, Arthur Hornblow and Theme Pictures
results.brief_description: Director Billy Wilder’s acclaimed 1957 courtroom melodrama based on Agatha Christie’s hit London play left audiences reeling from its surprise twists and shocking climax. Charles Laughton, Tyrone Power, Marlene Dietrich and Elsa Lanchester make this Oscar nominated classic a rivetiing experience. When a wealthy widow is found murdered, her married suitor, Leonard Vole (Power) is accused of the crime. At his trial, everyone is stunned when the prosecution calls Vole’s wife (Dietrich) to testify against him. Now it is more difficult than ever for Vole’s flamboyant defence attorney (Laughton) to prove that his client is innocent.
